scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.
SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: With horsemen, that make to him on the spur;
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Yet he spurs on. Now they are almost on him.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Now, Titinius! Now some light. O, he lights too.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: He's ta'en.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And, hark! they shout for joy.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Come down, behold no more.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: O, coward that I am, to live so long,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: To see my best friend ta'en before my face!
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Come hither, sirrah:
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: In Parthia did I take thee prisoner;
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And then I swore thee, saving of thy life,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: That whatsoever I did bid thee do,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Thou shouldst attempt it. Come now, keep thine oath;
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Now be a freeman: and with this good sword,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: That ran through Caesar's bowels, search this bosom.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Stand not to answer: here, take thou the hilts;
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And, when my face is cover'd, as 'tis now,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Guide thou the sword.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Caesar, thou art revenged,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Even with the sword that kill'd thee.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: So, I am free; yet would not so have been,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Durst I have done my will. O Cassius,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Far from this country Pindarus shall run,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Where never Roman shall take note of him.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: It is but change, Titinius; for Octavius
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Is overthrown by noble Brutus' power,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: As Cassius' legions are by Antony.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: These tidings will well comfort Cassius.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Where did you leave him?
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: All disconsolate,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: With Pindarus his bondman, on this hill.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Is not that he that lies upon the ground?
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: He lies not like the living. O my heart!
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Is not that he?
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: No, this was he, Messala,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: But Cassius is no more. O setting sun,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: As in thy red rays thou dost sink to-night,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: So in his red blood Cassius' day is set;
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: The sun of Rome is set! Our day is gone;
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Clouds, dews, and dangers come; our deeds are done!
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Mistrust of my success hath done this deed.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Mistrust of good success hath done this deed.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: O hateful error, melancholy's child,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Why dost thou show to the apt thoughts of men
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: The things that are not? O error, soon conceived,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Thou never comest unto a happy birth,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: But kill'st the mother that engender'd thee!
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: What, Pindarus! where art thou, Pindarus?
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Seek him, Titinius, whilst I go to meet
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: The noble Brutus, thrusting this report
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Into his ears; I may say, thrusting it;
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: For piercing steel and darts envenomed
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Shall be as welcome to the ears of Brutus
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: As tidings of this sight.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Hie you, Messala,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And I will seek for Pindarus the while.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Why didst thou send me forth, brave Cassius?
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Did I not meet thy friends? and did not they
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Put on my brows this wreath of victory,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And bid me give it thee? Didst thou not hear their shouts?
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Alas, thou hast misconstrued every thing!
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: But, hold thee, take this garland on thy brow;
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Thy Brutus bid me give it thee, and I
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Will do his bidding. Brutus, come apace,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And see how I regarded Caius Cassius.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: By your leave, gods:--this is a Roman's part
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Come, Cassius' sword, and find Titinius' heart.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Where, where, Messala, doth his body lie?
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Lo, yonder, and Titinius mourning it.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Titinius' face is upward.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: He is slain.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: O Julius Caesar, thou art mighty yet!
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Thy spirit walks abroad and turns our swords
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: In our own proper entrails.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Brave Titinius!
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Look, whether he have not crown'd dead Cassius!
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Are yet two Romans living such as these?
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: The last of all the Romans, fare thee well!
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: It is impossible that ever Rome
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Should breed thy fellow. Friends, I owe more tears
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: To this dead man than you shall see me pay.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: I shall find time, Cassius, I shall find time.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Come, therefore, and to Thasos send his body:
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: His funerals shall not be in our camp,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Lest it discomfort us. Lucilius, come;
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And come, young Cato; let us to the field.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Labeo and Flavius, set our battles on:
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: 'Tis three o'clock; and, Romans, yet ere night
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: We shall try fortune in a second fight.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Yet, countrymen, O, yet hold up your heads!
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: What bastard doth not? Who will go with me?
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: I will proclaim my name about the field:
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: I am the son of Marcus Cato, ho!
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: A foe to tyrants, and my country's friend;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: I am the son of Marcus Cato, ho!
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And I am Brutus, Marcus Brutus, I;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Brutus, my country's friend; know me for Brutus!
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: O young and noble Cato, art thou down?
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Why, now thou diest as bravely as Titinius;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And mayst be honour'd, being Cato's son.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Yield, or thou diest.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Only I yield to die:
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: There is so much that thou wilt kill me straight;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Kill Brutus, and be honour'd in his death.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: We must not. A noble prisoner!
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Room, ho! Tell Antony, Brutus is ta'en.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: I'll tell the news. Here comes the general.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Brutus is ta'en, Brutus is ta'en, my lord.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Where is he?
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Safe, Antony; Brutus is safe enough:
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: I dare assure thee that no enemy
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Shall ever take alive the noble Brutus:
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: The gods defend him from so great a shame!
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: When you do find him, or alive or dead,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: He will be found like Brutus, like himself.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: This is not Brutus, friend; but, I assure you,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: A prize no less in worth: keep this man safe;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Give him all kindness: I had rather have
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Such men my friends than enemies. Go on,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And see whether Brutus be alive or dead;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And bring us word unto Octavius' tent
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: How every thing is chanced.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Come, poor remains of friends, rest on this rock.
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Statilius show'd the torch-light, but, my lord,
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: He came not back: he is or ta'en or slain.
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Sit thee down, Clitus: slaying is the word;
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: It is a deed in fashion. Hark thee, Clitus.
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: What, I, my lord? No, not for all the world.
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Peace then! no words.
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: I'll rather kill myself.
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Hark thee, Dardanius.
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Shall I do such a deed?
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: O Dardanius!
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: O Clitus!
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: What ill request did Brutus make to thee?
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: To kill him, Clitus. Look, he meditates.
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Now is that noble vessel full of grief,
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: That it runs over even at his eyes.
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Come hither, good Volumnius; list a word.
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: What says my lord?
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Why, this, Volumnius:
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: The ghost of Caesar hath appear'd to me
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Two several times by night; at Sardis once,
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And, this last night, here in Philippi fields:
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: I know my hour is come.
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Not so, my lord.
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Nay, I am sure it is, Volumnius.
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Thou seest the world, Volumnius, how it goes;
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Our enemies have beat us to the pit:
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: It is more worthy to leap in ourselves,
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Than tarry till they push us. Good Volumnius,
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Thou know'st that we two went to school together:
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Even for that our love of old, I prithee,
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Hold thou my sword-hilts, whilst I run on it.
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: That's not an office for a friend, my lord.
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Fly, fly, my lord; there is no tarrying here.
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Farewell to you; and you; and you, Volumnius.
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Strato, thou hast been all this while asleep;
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Farewell to thee too, Strato. Countrymen,
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: My heart doth joy that yet in all my life
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: I found no man but he was true to me.
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: I shall have glory by this losing day
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: More than Octavius and Mark Antony
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: By this vile conquest shall attain unto.
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: So fare you well at once; for Brutus' tongue
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Hath almost ended his life's history:
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Night hangs upon mine eyes; my bones would rest,
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: That have but labour'd to attain this hour.
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Fly, my lord, fly.
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Hence! I will follow.
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: I prithee, Strato, stay thou by thy lord:
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Thou art a fellow of a good respect;
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Thy life hath had some smatch of honour in it:
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Hold then my sword, and turn away thy face,
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: While I do run upon it. Wilt thou, Strato?
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Give me your hand first. Fare you well, my lord.
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Farewell, good Strato.
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Caesar, now be still:
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: I kill'd not thee with half so good a will.
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: What man is that?
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: My master's man. Strato, where is thy master?
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Free from the bondage you are in, Messala:
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: The conquerors can but make a fire of him;
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: For Brutus only overcame himself,
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And no man else hath honour by his death.
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: So Brutus should be found. I thank thee, Brutus,
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: That thou hast proved Lucilius' saying true.
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: All that served Brutus, I will entertain them.
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Fellow, wilt thou bestow thy time with me?
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Ay, if Messala will prefer me to you.
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Do so, good Messala.
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: How died my master, Strato?
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: I held the sword, and he did run on it.
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Octavius, then take him to follow thee,
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: That did the latest service to my master.
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: This was the noblest Roman of them all:
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: All the conspirators save only he
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Did that they did in envy of great Caesar;
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: He only, in a general honest thought
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And common good to all, made one of them.
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: His life was gentle, and the elements
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: So mix'd in him that Nature might stand up
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And say to all the world 'This was a man!'
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: According to his virtue let us use him,
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: With all respect and rites of burial.
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Within my tent his bones to-night shall lie,
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Most like a soldier, order'd honourably.
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: So call the field to rest; and let's away,
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: To part the glories of this happy day.
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
